_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:20:00 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of respondents not able to contact their care coordinator changed?
analysis_commentary: The survey asks people about how easy it was to contact their care coordinator. The proportion of people who felt they could not contact their care coordinator if they had a problem has remained low at 4.0% every year. Therefore 96% of users could always or could sometimes contact their care coordinator if they had a problem.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
